Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a single conversation thread with a visitor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the conversation (visitor's email).

senderName.description: Name of the visitor who initiated the conversation.

lastMessageAt.description: Timestamp of the last message in the conversation.

typing.description: Indicates which users are currently typing.

groupId.description: The ID of the group this conversation belongs to.

messages.description: An array of messages within the conversation.

sentAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

sentBy.description: Indicates if the message was from the 'visitor' or 'admin'.

senderName.description: Name of the person sending the message.

senderEmail.description: Email of the person sending the message.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the user profile was created.

members.description: An array of conversation IDs that are members of this group.

AdminRole.title: Admin Role
AdminRole.description: A document indicating a user has admin privileges.

isAdmin.description: Set to true if the user is an admin.

definition.description: Stores conversation threads. Anyone can create a thread. Only authenticated users (admins) can read and update (reply).

params.name: conversationId
params.description: Unique identifier for the conversation document.

definition.description: Stores public-facing user profile information. The document ID is the same as the Firebase Auth UID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The user's unique ID from Firebase Authentication.

definition.description: Stores conversation groups. Only admins can manage groups.

params.name: groupId
params.description: Unique identifier for the group document.

definition.description: Stores admin role status for users. The document ID is the user's email.

firestore.reasoning: This design prioritizes security and scalability. A top-level `/conversations` collection stores message threads, identified by the sender's email to group messages. A separate `/users` collection stores user profiles, linking them by UID to Firebase Authentication. A new `/groups` collection allows admins to organize conversations. An `/adminRoles` collection provides a robust way to check for admin privileges in security rules.
